task: Sync data from AnkiWeb to AnkiDroid
task_end_condition: The task is known to be completed when the data from AnkiWeb is successfully synced to AnkiDroid.

working_memory.description: Touch on a button that has text "Sync from AnkiWeb"
By touching the "Sync from AnkiWeb" button, the user is taken to the login screen where they can enter their AnkiWeb account details to sync their data. (page changed from Introduction to Login)
Fill a textfield that has text "Email address" with "2797195863@qq.com"

The textfield with the placeholder "Email address" has been focused and filled with the email address "2797195863@qq.com". A new button with the content description "Clear text" has appeared on the screen.
Fill a password textfield that has text "Password" with "20080808"
The password textfield on the login screen has been successfully filled with the new password "20080808", replacing the previous placeholder text "Password".
Touch on a button that has text "Log in"

After touching the "Log in" button, the screen has transitioned from the Login page to the DeckPicker page, where a message about the outdated system WebView is displayed along with an option to "Learn More." (page changed from Login to DeckPicker)
Touch on a button that has text "Learn More"

After touching the "Learn More" button, the screen transitioned to a new page with options to either cancel or replace the current collection with a collection from AnkiDroid. Additionally, a popup message briefly appeared asking which collection to keep.
<The actions taken so far seem okay.>. <none>.
Touch on a button that has text "Replace"
By touching the "Replace" button, a new message informing about the outdated system WebView appears along with a "Learn More" button in the current screen.
Touch on a button that has text "Learn More"

By touching the "Learn More" button on the DeckPicker screen, the screen transitioned to the CustomTab screen where the button text changed to "Skip to content" and additional navigation buttons and widgets were added.
Press "BACK" button to navigate back

Navigating back led to a change from the "CustomTab" screen to the "DeckPicker" screen. The "Open drawer" button appeared in the current screen, along with information related to "Computer Science Flashcards" and a button to access the deck overview page. The previous screen's content regarding WebView detection and package updates was also shown in a popup message.
Touch on a button that has resource_id "fab_main"
The "fab_main" button is still present on the screen, allowing the user to easily access additional actions related to deck management in AnkiDroid.

The actions taken by fufu seem to be following the flow of the app, but there seems to be a loop of interacting with the "Learn More" button without progressing towards syncing data from AnkiWeb. fufu needs to explore the "Get shared decks" option to initiate the process of syncing data from AnkiWeb to AnkiDroid.
Touch on a button that has text "Get shared decks"

By touching the "Get shared decks" button, the screen transitioned from the DeckPicker to the SharedDecks screen, where the button "Navigate up" is now visible along with options related to downloading decks. (page changed from DeckPicker to SharedDecks)
Touch on a button that has content_desc "Home"
By touching the "Home" button, a focused scrollable area has appeared in the SharedDecks screen.
Scroll down on a focused scrollable area
Touch on a button that has content_desc "Home"
